text: If a snake falls on top of a man who is litigating
his lawsuit will be long.
If a snake falls on top of a man who is litigating
his lawsuit will be extremely protracted.
Wenn eine Schlange auf einen Mann fällt, der einen Rechtstreit führt: Dieser Rechtstreit wird lange andauern.
If a snake falls on top of a man who is litigating, but his lawsuit is already dragging on
his lawsuit will be settled.
If a snake falls on top of a man who is engaged in a lawsuit and his lawsuit is long, the man … will be used up.
If a snake falls onto a man who has been engaged in a protracted lawsuit
that lawsuit will be settled.
Wenn eine Schlange auf einen Mann fällt, der einen (schon) lang andauernden Rechtsstreit hat: Dieser Rechtstreit wird abgeschlossen werden.
If a snake hisses and falls onto a man who is litigating
his adversary will supplicate him.
If a snake falls on top of man who is engaged on a lawsuit …, his … will supplicate him.
If a snake falls onto a man who is being thrown into prison
that man will come out of prison; that man: (his) mind? will be at peace?.
If a snake falls on top of a man who has been thrown in prison, that man will go out from prison.
If a snake falls onto a man who is being thrown into prison
that man will come out of his prison and the mind of (that) man will be at peace.
Wenn eine Schlange auf einen Mann, der in Haft einsitz, fällt: Der Mann wird aus seiner Haft herauskommen und … .
If a snake bites a man who is litigating his adversary will supplicate him.
If a snake bites a man who is engaged in a lawsuit …
If a snake bites a man who is litigating
ditto (his adversary will supplicate him).
If a snake hisses and bites a man who is litigating
ditto (his adversary will supplicate him).
If a snake chatters and … a man who is engaged in a lawsuit, there will be … for him.
If a snake hisses and frightens a man
illness will afflict him ...; that man: the hand will take hold of him.
If a snake chatters and frightens a man, illness will afflict him.
If a snake stares at a man on a holiday
worry, unhappiness for the man ....
If a snake sees a man on a holiday
trouble; it will not be happy; … for the man; the hand (of a god) will affect that man.
If a snake stares at a man and he kills it
his fears will not touch that man, that snake took its evil away.
If a snake sees a man and he kills it, misfortunes will not approach that man; that snake, evil ….
If a snake stares at a man and scares him, so that (the man) tramples on its head and is afraid (of the snake)
loss of grain (but) that man will appease Marduk  and he will be well, he will experience good fortune.
If a snake sees a man and frightens him and he tramples its head and it thrashes (about)
loss of grain; Marduk will care for that man, and it will be good; he will experience good fortune.
If a snake stares at a man and scares him, so that (the man) tramples on its head and is very afraid (of the snake)
loss of grain (but) that man will appease Marduk and he will be well, he will experience good fortune.

Wenn eine Schlange einen Mann anschaut und ihn (dadurch) erschreckt und er dann auf ihren Kopf tritt und sich sehr (vor der Schlange) ängstigt: Verlust von Getreide, / diesen Mann wird Marduk gesund sein lassen und es wird ihm gut gehen, Gutes wird er erfahren.
If a snake stares at a man and scares him, or he tramples on its head and is afraid (of the snake)
loss of grain (but) that man will appease Marduk  and he will experience good fortune.

Wenn eine Schlange einen Mann anschaut und ihn erschreckt, oder er auf ihren Kopf tritt und sich dann sehr (vo der Schlange) ängstigt: Verlust von Getriede, / diesen Mann wird Marduk gesund sein lassen und er wird Gutes erfahren.
If a snake falls from above onto a man’s leg
a mortally ill person will die in the man’s house, the master of that house will experience misery and (then) he will die.
If a snake falls from above onto a man’s leg, a mortally ill person will die in the man’s house; the owner of that house will experience difficulty.
If a snake falls from above  onto a man’s leg
a mortally ill person will die in that man’s house, the master of the house will experience misery and (then) he will die.
If a snake constantly and continually obstructs a man’s path
his regular offerings will lessen.
If a snake constantly and everwhere is lying crosswise in front of man, … he will be humbled.
If a snake constantly and continually obstructs a man’s path
the man’s regular offerings will lessen.
If a snake goes wild and circles around a man
that man’s god will always lead him to good fortune.
If a snake goes wild and circles a man, that man’s god will follow him with good fortune.
If a snake hisses at a man
(this means that) evil will manifest itself and will affect (him).
If a snake caresses a man and … will rival.
Wenn eine Schlange einen Mann anzischt: Es ist übel und es wird (ihn) erreichen.
If a snake becomes excessively aggressive towards a man, attacks him and bites him
(though finding himself) in dire straits, that man will overcome his adversary.
If a snake is very hostile towards a man, attacks him and bites him
(though finding himself) in dire straits, that man will overcome his adversary.
If a snake crosses from a man’s right to the man’s left
he will have a good reputation.
If a snake crosses from a man’s left to a man’s right
his reputation will be cleared of evil.
If a snake crosses from a man’s left to a man’s right, he will acquire his reputation for evil.
If a man tramples on a snake’s head and then turns to the right

he will be thrown into prison for three years, (but) he will make (his) god turn back (to him) and he will survive. Ditto - hard imprisonment will obstruct the man’s path (but) he will continually seek out Marduk and his sign will pass him by.

12-13 Wenn ein Mann auf den Kopf einer Schlange tritt und er sich dann nach rechts umdreht: Drei Jahre (lang) wird er ins Gefängnis geworfen, aber er wird sich dem Gott zuwenden  und er wird überleben. / Dito: Schwere Haft wird sich dem Mann in den Weg stellen, (aber) er wird immer wieder Marduk aufsuchen und sein Vorzeichen wird an ihm vorübergehen.

If a man tramples a snake’s head and turns to the right, he will be cast down(?) in his place for three years and his god will turn (away?) and either imprisonment (or) difficulty will lie across the man’s path … will loosen and then his omen will bypass him.

iii 8'-9' … umdreht: Dieser Mann wird drei Jahre (lang) ins Gefängnis geworfen, (aber) er wird sich dem Gott zuwenden und er wird (es) überleben, / Dieser Mann wird Marduk aufsuchen und das Vorzeichen des Gefängnisses wird an ihm vorübergehen.
If a man tramples on a snake’s head and then turns to the right

he will be thrown into prison for three years, but (his) god will turn back (to him) and he will survive. Ditto - hard imprisonment will obstruct the man’s path (but) he will continually seek out Marduk and his sign will pass him by.
If a man tramples on a snake’s head and then? turns to the right?
that man will be thrown into prison for three years, but he will make (his) god turn back (to him) and he will survive; that? man will seek out Marduk and the sign of prison will <pas>s him by.
If a man tramples on a snake’s head and then turns to the left
he will be able to breath freely (being delivered) from misery and hardship, he will experience good fortune.
If a man tramples a snake’s head and turns to the left, he will … in privation and hardship; … he will experience good fortune.
If a man? tramples? on a snake’s head? and? then turns to the left?
that man will escape misery and hardship.
If a snake falls and (thereby) frightens a man and then the snake cries out
the hand of evil will take hold of that man.
If a snake frightens a man by falling and then the snake cries out, an evil hand will affect that man.
If a snake falls and (thereby) frightens a man, but he does not cry out
attainment of a wish.
If a snake frightens a man by falling but <does> not cry out - attainment of a wish.
Wenn eine Schlange beim Fallen einen Mann erschreckt, aber er (dabei) nicht schreit: Gelingen eines Vorhabens.
If a snake coils in front of a man and lies down
wailing, the man will die.
If a snake eats itself
wailing (but) that man will live.
If a snake eats itself
establishment of ... ... in his mouth; the man’s wife will bear a male child.
If a snake holds its tail in its mouth
the wife of the man will give birth to a son.
If a snake holds its tail in its mouth and a second snake lies down on top (of it)
there will be famine in the land, the wife (of the man)? will die and that house will be dispersed.
If a snake eats itself and then the snake become double and onto ..., that house will be dispersed.
Wenn eine Schlange ihren Schwanz in ihrem Maul trägt und ... ... lagert: / Eine Hungersnot wird im Land auftreten, oder dieses Haus wird zerstreut werden.
If a lizard … … …
If a lizard … … a man …
If a lizard falls on …
confusion, grief.
If a lizard falls …
confusion; trouble.
If a lizard … falls on …
all his possessions will disappear.
If a lizard falls …, his belonging will be lost.
If a lizard … falls on …
he will prevail over lit: stand on his legal adversary.
If a lizard falls in front of a man, he will prevail over his adversary.
If a lizard … falls on …
the accomplishment of a desire (will occur).
If a lizard falls ...
attainment of his desire.
If a lizard … falls on …
he will overcome his legal opponent.
If a lizard falls in front of man, he will prevail over his adversary.
If a gecko … in a man's house like … - in the man's house income …
33.1 If a gecko like … in a man's house, that house, income ….
If a gecko … in a man's household's cattle pen …
If a gecko … in the bedroom of a man's house …
If a gecko … in the middle of a man's house …
If a gecko … in the doorway of a man's house …
If a gecko … from a man's house …
If a gecko … from …
If a gecko … ditto
the owner of the house …
if a gecko …  ditto
the owner of that house …
if a gecko … a man ditto
the owner of that house …
if geckos … go out …
that house …
if geckos … … the owner of the house …
if geckos climb up the wall in the house of a man
the house …
if geckos come down the wall in a man's house, the owner of that house …
if geckos come down the wall in a man's house
the owner of that house …
If geckos in a man's house go out from the house to the door
the owner of that house will … a food offering.
If geckos in the house of a man go in from the doorway to the house
the owner of that house … a son.
If geckos in a man's house climb up from the ground to the roof
the owner of that house will reach the highest position.
If geckos in a man's house climb up from the ground to the roof, the owner of that house will go to ruin.
If geckos in a man's house climb down from the roof to the ground
he will escape from hardship.
If a white ditto  is seen in the house of a man
hardship will afflict the owner of the house.
If a white gecko is seen in the house of a man
the owner of that house: hardship will afflict him.
If a red ditto is seen in the house of a man
the owner of that house will continue to prosper.
If a ...
If an ant nest in a man's house is repeatedly opened
in that house, the ways will be cut.
If a ditto (= ant) nest is seen in a man's house
the heritage of that house will be taken and nothing will be left.
If an ant nest is seen in a man's house
from (?) the heritage of that house will be taken and nothing will be left.
If an ant nest is destroyed in a man's house
a breach will be made in that house.
If an unusual nest of ditto (= ants) with wings is seen in a man's house
that house will collapse : be torn down.
If white or black ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house in their nest
the owner of the house will die and from his possessions, nothing will be left.
If ants run about a lot in a man's house
the owner of that house will die and that house will collapse.
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house in a (= their) nest and the black ones kill the multicolored ones
decision … income.
If ants are seen in a hole in a man's house and black ones kill multicolored ones
with a delivery, income.
If ditto (= ants) are numerous in a man's house
the ways to the man's house will be cut.
If ants are numerous in a man's house
the ways (and) roads to the man's house will be cut.
If ditto (= ants) give birth in a man's house
collapse of the house.
If ditto (= ants) bring out of a man's house something they have dug out
that house will acquire wealth.
If ditto (= ants) are small, run about, and fight a battle in a man's house
that house will not be in agreement.
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house at the entrance of the outer gate
collapse of the house.
If ants are seen in a man's house on the door jamb of the entrance of the outer gate
collapse of the house ….
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house in the corners of the outer door
there will be an uprising in the house of the man.
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house above of the outer door
dispersal of the house(hold).
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house on the threshhold of the outer gate
dispersal of the house(hold), there will be an uprising in the house of the man.
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house on the threshhold of the outer gate
dispersal of the house(hold), an uprising will go into the house of the man.
If he sees ditto (= ants) in a man's house
the owner of that house will become poor, or a dying man will die.
If one sees ants in a house, the owner of that house will become poor (and) die and a dying man will die.
If he sees ants in a man's house
the owner of the house will become poor, or a dying man will die.
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house in …
the possessions of the house will come to an end.
If ditto (= ants) are seen on the path in a man's house
lots of traffic : additional traffic.
If ditto (= ants) are seen in a man's house
decrease of traffic : … will go out of the man's house.
If ants are seen in a man's house on top of vessels
the properties of that house will decline.
If ants give birth on the vessels of a man's house
abandonment of the house.
